image.altText: A composite of images: a red car driving on a road, a sign saying "rough surface", and potholes in a road.

props.synopsis: Queensland drivers say they are fed up with politicians flying around on planes and ignoring the dangerous condition of the state's road network, as people continue to die in crashes.

title.children: Queenslanders call on premier to swap his plane for a car and drive the Bruce Highway

image.altText: High shot of tropical island

props.synopsis: Phone and internet outages are causing chaos for tourism businesses at one of Queensland's most popular tourist spots, Magnetic Island.

title.children: Travellers warned of phone, internet outages at popular tourist island as school holidays start

image.altText: 2 Little Green Island

props.synopsis: British-American movie producer and actor Douglas Gresham sells Little Green Island to a North Queensland family, putting it back in Australian hands.

title.children: Australian island that inspired the Narnia movies sells at auction for $5.6 million

image.altText: An older man on a grassy area with a ship in the background.

props.synopsis: Anyone who has worked in a coal mine is entitled to free black lung testing without a referral, but those who handle coal through the ports and rail network face a more arduous process.

title.children: 'It's getting harder and harder to breathe': Push for black lung testing for all workers handling coal

image.altText: A graphic with two mobile phones showing Steven Miles holding a sauce bottle on one and David Crisafulli eating an ice cream

props.synopsis: With the Queensland poll six weeks away, two of the state's key candidates have been tapping into the socials.

title.children: It's the 'year of the TikTok election' — and politicians are tapping in

image.altText: camel racing

props.synopsis: From races and rodeos to festivals and fairs, event tourism is the lifeblood for many businesses in outback Queensland, but towns are bracing for a bleak tourism season next year as the cost of living crisis puts the crunch on iconic events.

title.children: Outback Queensland braces for tough tourism season after Big Red Bash cancels for 2025

image.altText: Exposed timber beams inside a house which is under construction.

props.synopsis: It's not just Australian home owners who are being left to struggle as large numbers of builders go bust. Contractors, too, are facing hefty losses.

title.children: 'Big red flags': This couple have been left with an incomplete house after their builder went bust

image.altText: Annelies Zeissink wears glasses and an orange top.

props.synopsis: Queensland will benefit from cheaper public transport permanently after the "huge success" of a trial of 50 cent fares, with the government and LNP promising to keep the fares in place.

title.children: 'We'll make use of it': Commuters react to promise to keep 50 cent public transport fares in Queensland

image.altText: A young woman in a multicoloured jumper looks off camera

props.synopsis: Robert and Anne Geeves are found not guilty of murder, following a long trial held more than 20 years after Ms Haigh's disappearance in 2002.

title.children: Couple not guilty of murdering 19-year-old mum Amber Haigh

image.altText: A man in a scraggly beard and a teenage boy shrugs as two well-groomed rats scurry across their shoulders.

props.synopsis: A job, a return to school, and a veggie garden are some of the things this family is looking forward to now that they have a place to call home.

title.children: Kenny found being homeless went hand in hand with being jobless, but the tide is finally turning for him

image.altText: Printed photos of a bag and a gun and a camera are seen taped to a wall

props.synopsis: The FBI says Donald Trump was the target of what appears to be an attempted assassination at his golf club in West Palm Beach, Florida. This is what we know.

title.children: What we know about the second apparent assassination attempt on Donald Trump

image.altText: Donald Trump

props.synopsis: Investigators say a Secret Service agent opened fire on a gunman at Trump's Florida golf course after seeing a rifle barrel poking through a fence while the former president was on the course. A suspect has been taken into custody. Look back on our live coverage.

title.children: Suspect in custody after apparent second attempt to assassinate Trump, FBI says

image.altText: Lachlan Murdoch and James packer walk and talk, Sarah Murdoch smiles walking in centre. All three on a grand prix track

props.synopsis: James Packer and Lachlan Murdoch have tracked similar highs and lows, all the while remaining very different characters, but if we are all stamped early on, their defining characteristic is that they grew up in the long shadow cast by their famous fathers.

title.children: The moment that almost ended James Packer and Lachlan Murdoch's friendship

image.altText: Sue La Velle

props.synopsis: Photos and a box of ashes are all Sue La Velle has after her son was found dead in a Melbourne home in June. She's sharing her story for the first time in the hope it will prevent others from meeting the same fate.

title.children: A synthetic opioid more potent than fentanyl is spreading across Australia with fatal consequences

image.altText: A man looks into the camera with a solemn expression, in a portrait taken in a park.

props.synopsis: In 2015, ASIC warned Australia's banks to watch out for an overseas investment scam and take action to prevent people falling victim to it. Months later, David Sweeney's father lost $1 million to the very same scheme.

title.children: David's father lost $1 million to an overseas scam. Months earlier, banks were told to block it

image.altText: A flag with the letter CFMEU on a building site with an urban backdrop

props.synopsis: An investigation by a prominent barrister has found the CFMEU's construction division was still under the influence of criminal elements, including bikie gangs.

title.children: Report finds CFMEU construction division made 'inadequate' attempts to root out bikies

image.altText: Frances Rodger and her husband Ed, and their cat in a selfie photo, Tamworth, 2024.

props.synopsis: The silence around menopause has long been the norm in rural Australia — now a new generation of women are trying to reshape attitudes and services around this normal, natural phase of life.

title.children: 'Two years in the wilderness' could have been solved by the right menopause care, but still regional women suffer in silence

image.altText: A close up of Kate Moegel smiling in a restaurant wearing a black top.

props.synopsis: In popular tourist areas far from major cities, a lack of affordable accommodation for workers has seen staff jammed into unsuitable housing. But a new investment model for worker housing hopes to fix the problem.

title.children: Australia has a worker housing shortage. Now companies are turning to old infrastructure for solutions

image.altText: A composite image of close up shots of Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton.

props.synopsis: Last week the prime minister finally sounded like he was setting the agenda rather than constantly dodging hits, but a question from the US presidential debate could prove dangerous closer to the election.

title.children: There's one question from the US debate that could prove dangerous in Australia's next election

image.altText: Three ducks stand in snow

props.synopsis: Temperatures across south-east Australia have plummeted during the past 48 hours, leading to the coldest spring weather in decades.

title.children: Record spring cold snap delivers snow and severe frost to south-east Australia

image.altText: Picture of Jina Amini during protest

props.synopsis: While the world is focused on other parts of the Middle East, the Iranian people are fighting their own battles against a harsh government crackdown on women who unveil, and a ramp up in arrests and use of the death penalty.

title.children: As the world's attention focuses on a regional war, Iran's women are fighting a 'quiet revolution'

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal MP Moira Deeming's defamation case against Victorian Opposition Leader John Pesutto has begun in the Federal Court.

title.children: Victorian opposition leader 'tarred' MP with 'the Nazi brush', defamation case hears

image.altText: An actress stands on stage in a black dress holding an Emmy statue at a microphone

props.synopsis: Australian actress Elizabeth Debicki has won an Emmy for her role as Princess Diana in The Crown. This and other highlights from the 76th Emmy awards.

title.children: Elizabeth Debicki wins Emmy for playing Princess Diana in The Crown

image.altText: A man sits with glasses on

props.synopsis: Tito Jackson, the third of nine Jackson children, including global superstars Michael and Janet, has died.

title.children: Tito Jackson, member of The Jackson 5, dies aged 70

image.altText: An image of outside Manchester City's stadium, with a big banner saying "The best team in the land and all the world".

props.synopsis: The 'sports trial of the century' that the football world is waiting for — a private hearing to rule on Manchester City's 115 alleged financial breaches of Premier League rules — will begin today in England.

title.children: 'Sports trial of the century' to kick off into Manchester City's 115 alleged financial breaches

image.altText: a pastoralist wearing a red collared shirt with his arms crossed in front of a level crossing

props.synopsis: A Northern Territory pastoralist has called for safety upgrades to an outback railway crossing where a cattle truck collided with The Ghan tourist train on Sunday, saying it's a "dangerous spot".

title.children: Pastoralist calls for upgrades at 'dangerous' rail crossing where cattle truck struck The Ghan

image.altText: Troy Bell walks outside a court building holding a note pad.

props.synopsis: The defence lawyer for independent MP Troy Bell says the case against the politician is "misguided and misleading".

title.children: Fraud case against MP has 'more holes than a Balfours crumpet', defence lawyer says

image.altText: A Qantas plane on a runway, with a slab of the tarmac coming loose from behind.

props.synopsis: Teenage plane spotter Mitchell Booth recalls how he filmed the moment a Qantas aircraft damaged the main runway at Perth Airport at the weekend.

title.children: Teenage plane spotter captures moment aircraft rips up the runway during take-off

image.altText: A group of older high school students ar work in a classroom.

props.synopsis: A NSW Catholic high school will allow senior students to learn from home one day a week permanently following a trial that found the program helped students become more independent despite concerns about a lack of structure.

title.children: Private school adopts four-day week permanently after successful trial

image.altText: Two women standing on their front porch

props.synopsis: The ACT's new assisted reproduction technology laws were introduced to protect the wellbeing of donor-conceived people, but IVF patients and doctors say they're having unintended consequences for women now trying to fall pregnant with donated sperm.

title.children: Anna and Alex are desperate for a baby. New IVF donor laws have made that 'near impossible'

image.altText: A rescuer walks across floodwaters

props.synopsis: The death toll from flooding in central Europe has risen to eight people as thousands of people are evacuated from their homes.

title.children: Eight killed as flooding devastates Romania, Czechia and Poland

image.altText: Aerial vision of a black car with both doors open and a battered front near the middle of an intersection.

props.synopsis: Members of the public have overpowered a man after he allegedly fired a shot, and tried to drag a woman from her car in Doncaster.

title.children: Man placed under citizen's arrest after allegedly firing gun following car crash in Melbourne's east

image.altText: Man faces camera with sunglasses, cap and ear muffs, holds a cracked shotgun over his shoulder

props.synopsis: Olympic athletes and an event organiser are concerned new WA gun laws passed earlier this year could spell the end of clay target shooting competitions like Geraldton's annual Crayfish Carnival.

title.children: Fears new WA gun laws will shake up gun clubs and end target shooting competition

image.altText: A woman in overalls in an art studio laughs.

props.synopsis: Jenna Pickering lives in one of the most naturally beautiful parts of the world, but it is the people — not the landscapes — that inspire her paintings.

title.children: Award-winning artist embraces 'every wrinkle' as she captures beauty of aging
